result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Returned Order for PSI from Dodge Correctional

ADDRESS INFO for Charles Norris Kurkowski
Current: 7410 Co. Rd. K, #122, c/o Burnett County Jail, Siren, WI 54872 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2022)
Prior: P.O. Box 661, c/o Dodge Correctional #426558, Waupun, WI 53963-0661 United States
Sentencing hearing on December 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:35 AM Cases 18CF185, 21CF213, and 22CF52 called together.  Defendant Charles Norris Kurkowski in court, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Charles Norris Kurkowski.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea Hearing.  Cases are VR compliant, victim appears in person.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollak: def pleading to amended count of theft $5-$10k in 22CF52 (already amended, Count 1), and possession of meth in 21CF213, request PSI, state capped at PSI, part of restitution is stipulated- needs restitution hearing for catalytic converters.  Court reviews PLQ, prints for def to review and sign.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas. Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 of 21CF213 and Count 1 of 22CF52 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and case 18CF185 are DRI.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Court acknowledges motion for bond modification; Court denies, revokes bond at this time.
Signed copy
Sentencing hearing on December 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Proposed Writ of Habeas Corpus
bail/bond

Amended 8/24/22. In lieu of an order revoking bond, Judge Mogen ordered an amended cash bond off the record. The defendant must post $3,000 cash to be released from custody, to cover Burnett County Cases 18CF185, 21CF213, and 22CF52.  If the defendant is unable to post this bond before his release from prison, he must be returned to the Burnett County Jail.  No contact with the victims.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
Plea hearing on September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:46 AM Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Charles Norris Kurkowski.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def does not appear at this time.  After going off the record, Court realized def is to be released prior to next hearing date.  Court is revoking the defendant's bonds in 18CF185, 21CF213, and 22CF52; so once def is released from prison, he will be transported to the Burnett County jail.  Atty Pollak provides programming information.

10:04 AM Cases 18CF185, 21CF213, and 22CF52 called together.  Defendant Charles Norris Kurkowski appeared by video, appearing from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Charles Norris Kurkowski.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for Plea Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollak: def pleading to Ct 1 of 21CF213: possession of methamphetamine and amended Ct 1 22CF52- theft $5k-$10k (FH); DRI all others, request PSI, parties free to argue but State capped at PSI recommendation; stipulated restitution in the amount of everything except the amount of the catalytic converters, requesting a restitution hearing for those (stipulated amount is $2,065).  State moves to amend count 1 of 22CF52 as stated; court grants.  Discussion clarifying if def pleading in 18CF185 or 21CF213 held (21CF213, Count 1 as-charged).  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Discussion of def's understanding of case and rights.  Def wants to talk to his atty.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Supplement to Dispositional Order (Restitution) with Invoice

Plea hearing on May 16, 2022 at 11:15 am.

11:29 AM Called 18CF185 and 21CF213 for STC and 22CF52 for WOPH originally scheduled as a PH.  Defendant Charles Norris Kurkowski in court with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak who appeared by video.  Defendant in custody with the Burnett County Jail, appears in person. DA James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin in person. Def and Attny confirm Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information, mirrors criminal complaint.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Global offer was presented.  Attny Pollak asks to speak on bond. Confirm open bond to cover 18CF185 and 21CF213 for $1,200 which is posted. Def is ready for transportation, will serve 1 year 1 month in prison.  Confirm no active warrant on def here.  Since def in custody DA will allow transportation.  Attny Pollak recites offer, Plead to Meth as felony, theft I-felony, and Bail jump DRI, capped and PSI. DA notes about $5,000 restitution, Attny Pollak would stipulate to part and ask for restitution hearing on part.  Vic Witness Coordinator, whichever Judge prefers on transport to prison or stay here.  Judge notes on bond in 2 other cases, will remain.  Can set a PLEAH May 16th at 11:15am, if prison needs to reschedule contact JA.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

09:36 AM Cases 18CF185, 21CF213, and 22CF52 called together.  Defendant Charles Norris Kurkowski in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant in custody appearing from Burnett County jail.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Charles Norris Kurkowski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Cases on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: global resolution likely, will need prelim, wants to review bond in the near future (def wants to go serve his sentence on the revocation matter).  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Status conference on March 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:21 AM Cases 18CF185, 21CF213, and 22CF52 called together.  Defendant Charles Norris Kurkowski in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Charles Norris Kurkowski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case on for motion hearing on motion to modify bond.  Atty Pollak argues in support.  State not opposing, makes record.  Offer recited by ADA: plead to meth in 21CF213, fel bail jump and theft in 22CF52, $5,315 restitution, PSI, state capped at PSI.  Court denies bond motion at this time, wants def and atty to discuss offer and will revisit bond at that next date.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on March 14, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2022 at 11:15 am.

01:17 PM Called 18CF185, 21CF213 and 22CF52 scheduled for STC.  Defendant Charles Norris Kurkowski in court with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant in custody from the Burnett County jail.  ADA Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin in person.  Charles Norris Kurkowski appeared by video means with Attorney by separate video.  State indicates they are in victim rights compliance, so 22CF52 is on for INIT.    Case 22CF52 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Waive time limits for PH.  Attny Pollack updates the court, now that this new 2022 case has been filed will be able to move forward.  Bond continues.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 11:15 am.
